title: Google Fi Is 10 Years Old, Celebrate With a Free Pixel 9 Pro
description: Google Fi has turned 10, bringing a Pixel deal, a new plan, and more data on older plans.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: Google Fi has turned 10, bringing a Pixel deal, a new plan, and more data on older plans.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. In the intersection of smartphone OEMs and mobile network carriers, Google might be the only major brand sitting in that spot. With Google Fi Wireless, you get to enjoy the tech giant's mobile carrier, and you might not realize it, but it has been 10 years since that brand was launched. It's come a long way. To celebrate this day, Google has decided to add a new plan to its portfolio, called Unlimited Essentials. However, that's not the only new thing that it's doing. It is also increasing data allowances on its other unlimited plans. And perhaps the best of the bunch is the chance to get a Pixel 9 Pro and a Pixel Watch 3 for free. Unlimited Essentials Gives You Google Fi Wireless in the Most Barebones Form Image: Google Fi It's Google Fi Wireless' 10th anniversary, so there are few better days to announce as much as they're announcing than today. Unlimited Essentials is meant to be for those who want just the essentials and don't want to have to pay more than they really need to. With that in mind, it does a good job. Unlimited Essentials will give you unlimited talk, text, and data, as expected. You'll also get a 30GB allowance for high-speed data when you're in the US. It will set you back by $35 for a single line each month. Google Increases Data Allowance on Older Unlimited Plans Image: Google Fi To make things even better for those who are existing subscribers to Google Fi Wireless, the tech giant has decided to make things a little sweeter if you're on one of its existing Unlimited plans. It'll increase how much high-speed data you get to enjoy—both regular cellular data and hotspot data. Unlimited StandardUnlimited PremiumOld High-Speed Limit35GB50GBNew High-Speed Limit50GB100GBOld Hotspot Allowance5GB50GBNew Hotspot Allowance25GB50GBMonthly Price Per Line$50$65 Plus, it has to be mentioned that with Unlimited Premium, you also get six months of free YouTube Premium, data in 200+ countries, 100GB of Google One storage, and more. Get the Pixel 9 Pro and the Pixel Watch 3 for Free Image: Google If you've never used Google Fi before, the carrier really wants you to come and try things out on their side of life. New subscribers will get the opportunity to get the Google Pixel 9 Pro and the Pixel Watch 3 for free. Image: Google However, you will want to know the structure of “free” in this case. For the Google Pixel 9 Pro, you will get an instant $300 discount at the moment that you purchase the device. However, the remaining $699 is going to get paid off over the next 24 months via bill credits. The structure is similar for the Pixel Watch 3 too, as you'll get $100 off right away and then $349 will be paid off via bill credits for the next 24 months. This deal will only be available until April 29th, though. If you're already a Google Fi customer, you'll get to celebrate with Google via instant rebate discounts on any Pixel 9 device. Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

In the intersection of smartphone OEMs and mobile network carriers, Google might be the only major brand sitting in that spot. With Google Fi Wireless, you get to enjoy the tech giant's mobile carrier, and you might not realize it, but it has been 10 years since that brand was launched. It's come a long way.

To celebrate this day, Google has decided to add a new plan to its portfolio, called Unlimited Essentials. However, that's not the only new thing that it's doing. It is also increasing data allowances on its other unlimited plans. And perhaps the best of the bunch is the chance to get a Pixel 9 Pro and a Pixel Watch 3 for free.

Unlimited Essentials Gives You Google Fi Wireless in the Most Barebones Form

It's Google Fi Wireless' 10th anniversary, so there are few better days to announce as much as they're announcing than today. Unlimited Essentials is meant to be for those who want just the essentials and don't want to have to pay more than they really need to. With that in mind, it does a good job.

Unlimited Essentials will give you unlimited talk, text, and data, as expected. You'll also get a 30GB allowance for high-speed data when you're in the US. It will set you back by $35 for a single line each month.

Google Increases Data Allowance on Older Unlimited Plans

To make things even better for those who are existing subscribers to Google Fi Wireless, the tech giant has decided to make things a little sweeter if you're on one of its existing Unlimited plans. It'll increase how much high-speed data you get to enjoy—both regular cellular data and hotspot data.

Plus, it has to be mentioned that with Unlimited Premium, you also get six months of free YouTube Premium, data in 200+ countries, 100GB of Google One storage, and more.

Get the Pixel 9 Pro and the Pixel Watch 3 for Free

If you've never used Google Fi before, the carrier really wants you to come and try things out on their side of life. New subscribers will get the opportunity to get the Google Pixel 9 Pro and the Pixel Watch 3 for free.

However, you will want to know the structure of “free” in this case.

  • For the Google Pixel 9 Pro, you will get an instant $300 discount at the moment that you purchase the device. However, the remaining $699 is going to get paid off over the next 24 months via bill credits.
  • The structure is similar for the Pixel Watch 3 too, as you'll get $100 off right away and then $349 will be paid off via bill credits for the next 24 months. This deal will only be available until April 29th, though.
  • If you're already a Google Fi customer, you'll get to celebrate with Google via instant rebate discounts on any Pixel 9 device.

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
